title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 145-6.5 - Science and technology entry program
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 145-6.5 - Science and technology entry program

State Regulations
(a) As used in the definition of eligible
students set forth in Education Law, section 6454(b), minorities historically
underrepresented in the scientific, technical, health and health-related
professions shall include residents of New York State or students who meet the
requirements set forth in subparagraph (ii) of paragraph a or subparagraph (ii)
of paragraph b of subdivision five of section
661
of the

Education Law, as applicable, who are black, Hispanic, American Indian or

Alaskan native. (b) Program
administration. Activities funded under the science and technology entry
program shall be administered pursuant to a contract between the State

Education Department and the participating institutions or consortia of
institutions. (c) In awarding
contracts for the science and technology entry program, priority shall be given
among those eligible applicants who meet all requirements set forth in

Education Law, section 6454(5)(a) to those who have proven records of success
in minority recruitment and retention and show a matching contribution in
excess of that required pursuant to Education Law, section
6454(5)(a)(3). Notes
